content:
Yes, there are similar initiatives for promoting social justice in other regions of Russia. For example, the city of Moscow has implemented several policies aimed at improving social justice and equality. One initiative is the "My District" program, which aims to decentralize decision-making and give citizens more control over local services and infrastructure. The city has also established a social assistance fund to provide financial support to low-income families and individuals.

In addition to this, there are several non-governmental organizations (NGOs) working to promote social justice and equality in Russia. For instance, the Center for Social and Labor Rights is an organization dedicated to protecting workers' rights and providing support to vulnerable groups such as migrant workers, women, and people with disabilities.

Overall, while there is still work to be done to promote social justice and equality in Russia, there are several initiatives and organizations working towards this goal in different regions of the country.
